page.title: 19TRANSPORT ALONG THE A34
page.content: Over the years transport has changed Bradford Lane was cobbled so that the horses pulling carts would not loose their grip.Now we travel by car and on buses. There are 29 buses from Macclesfield to Manchester and 27 buses from Manchester to Macclesfield all going along the A34 every weekday. There are two bus companys operating the route:Crosvile which has green buses and Greater Manchester Transport which has orange ones. Most of the buses are double decker and you pay the driver. There are no speed restrictions on the A34 and there is no lollipop lady for the school which makes crossing the road difficult. All the workers from ICI make the road very busy particularly in the early morning and again in the evening.
